Gloria Warren (born Gloria Weiman on April 7, 1926) is an American actress, pianist and singer.
Career.
Her movie career began in 1942 with Warner Bros.. That same year, she appeared in her first motion picture, "Always in My Heart". Her singing voice was often compared to that of Deanna Durbin.
She made four more movies after that, including "Dangerous Money" and "Bells of San Fernando", and retired from show business in 1947.
